info.description: CM-Beetle recommends optimal target cloud infrastructure and executes migration.
info.title: CM-Beetle API

get.description:
Checks and returns the HTTP protocol version of the incoming request.

[Note]
- The X-Request-Id header value (auto-generated if not provided) is propagated to Tumblebug when Beetle calls its APIs for distributed tracing.
get.summary: Check HTTP version of incoming request

parameters.description: Unique request ID (auto-generated if not provided). Used for tracking request status and correlating logs.
parameters.name: X-Request-Id

post.description:
Migrate data from source to target

[Note]
* Both source and destination must be remote endpoints (SSH or object storage).
* Local filesystem access is not allowed for security reasons.
* Strategy options: auto (default), direct, relay.
* For SSH endpoints, supports PrivateKey content or PrivateKeyPath.

[Note]
* Examples(test result): https://github.com/cloud-barista/cm-beetle/blob/main/docs/test-results-data-migration.md
post.summary: Migrate data from source to target

500.description: Internal server error during data migration

get.description:
Get the list of all object storages (buckets) in the specified cloud service provider and region

[Note] Connection name format: `{csp}-{region}` (e.g., aws-ap-northeast-2)

parameters.description: Unique request ID (auto-generated if not provided). Used for tracking request status and correlating logs.
parameters.name: X-Request-Id

500.description: Internal server error during list operation

post.description:
Migrate object storages to cloud based on recommendation results

[Note] This API creates object storages (buckets) in the target cloud.
- Input should be the output from RecommendObjectStorage API
- Connection name format: `{csp}-{region}` (e.g., aws-ap-northeast-2)

[Note]
* Examples(test result): https://github.com/cloud-barista/cm-beetle/blob/main/docs/test-results-data-migration.md
post.summary: Migrate object storages to cloud

parameters.description: Object storage migration request (use RecommendObjectStorage response)
parameters.name: request

parameters.description: Unique request ID (auto-generated if not provided). Used for tracking request status and correlating logs.
parameters.name: X-Request-Id

500.description: Internal server error during object storage creation

[Note] Connection name format: `{csp}-{region}` (e.g., aws-ap-northeast-2)

parameters.description: Unique request ID (auto-generated if not provided). Used for tracking request status and correlating logs.
parameters.name: X-Request-Id

500.description: Internal server error during get operation

delete.description:
Delete a specific object storage (bucket)

[Note]
- Connection name format: `{csp}-{region}` (e.g., aws-ap-northeast-2)
- The bucket must be empty before deletion

parameters.description: Unique request ID (auto-generated if not provided). Used for tracking request status and correlating logs.
parameters.name: X-Request-Id

head.description:
Check if a specific object storage (bucket) exists

[Note]
- Connection name format: `{csp}-{region}` (e.g., aws-ap-northeast-2)
- Returns 200 OK if the bucket exists, 404 Not Found if it doesn't exist

parameters.description: Unique request ID (auto-generated if not provided). Used for tracking request status and correlating logs.
parameters.name: X-Request-Id

500.description: Internal server error during existence check

post.description:
Recommend an appropriate object storage for cloud migration

[Note] `desiredCsp` and `desiredRegion` are required.
- `desiredCsp` and `desiredRegion` can set on the query parameter or the request body.

- If desiredCsp and desiredRegion are set on request body, the values in the query parameter will be ignored.

[Warning] the recommended bucket name may be globally unique.
- Beetle supports adding a suffix based on the existing bucket name to ensure uniqueness.
- Suppose that the existing bucket name is unique enough.
- Generate a suffix based on the existing bucket name.
- e.g., "my-bucket" -> SHA256 hash -> base64 URL-safe encoding (6 bytes) -> lowercase -> "my-bucket-{suffix}"

Recommend an appropriate VM specification for cloud migration

[Note] `desiredProvider` and `desiredRegion` are required.
- `desiredProvider` and `desiredRegion` can set on the query parameter or the request body.

- If desiredProvider and desiredRegion are set on request body, the values in the query parameter will be ignored.
- If `targetMachineId` is provided, only that specific machine will be processed.

parameters.name: X-Request-Id

post.description:
Recommend best-effort VM infrastructure (MCI) candidates for migrating on-premise workloads to cloud environments.

- See overview and examples on https://github.com/cloud-barista/cm-beetle/discussions/256

**[Required Parameters: `desiredCsp`, `desiredRegion`]** The desired cloud service provider and region for the recommended infrastructure.
- if **desiredCsp** and **desiredRegion** are set on request body, the values in the query parameter will be ignored.

**[Optional Parameters: `limit`]** Maximum number of recommended infrastructures to return (default: 3)

**[Optional Parameters: `minMatchRate`]** Minimum match rate threshold for highly-matched classification (default: 90.0, range: 0-100)

**[Response Field: `status`]** Candidate status based on the match rate threshold
- **highly-matched**: Candidates meet or exceed the match rate threshold
- **partially-matched**: Valid candidates below the match rate threshold

**[Response Field: `description`]** Summary containing Candidate ID, status, match rate statistics (Min/Max/Avg), and VM counts
- Example: "Candidate #1 | partially-matched | Overall Match Rate: Min=88.9% Max=100.0% Avg=98.7% | VMs: 3 total, 2 matched, 1 acceptable"
post.summary: Recommend multiple VM infrastructure candidates for cloud migration

parameters.description: Specify the your infrastructure to be migrated
parameters.name: UserInfra

parameters.description: Limit (default: 3) the number of recommended infrastructures
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Minimum match rate for highly-matched classification (default: 90.0, range: 0-100)
parameters.name: minMatchRate

parameters.description: Unique request ID (auto-generated if not provided). Used for tracking request status and correlating logs.
parameters.name: X-Request-Id

post.description: Generate a comprehensive migration report comparing source infrastructure with target cloud VMs, including resource mappings, network/security analysis, cost summary, and recommendations in Markdown or HTML format
post.summary: Generate migration report (with source-target correlation analysis)

parameters.description: Download as file: true for file download, false for inline display (only affects browsers/Swagger UI, not curl)
parameters.name: download

200.description: Migration report in markdown or HTML format

Content-Disposition.description: inline; filename=\"migration-report.md\" or \"migration-report.html\" (or attachment when download=true)

500.description: Internal server error during report generation

get.description:
Retrieves the details of a specific API request tracked by Beetle.

[Note]
- Request tracking is managed independently by Beetle (not shared with Tumblebug).
- The reqId corresponds to the X-Request-Id header value from a previous API call.
- Do NOT call Tumblebug's /request/{reqId} API with this reqId; each system manages its own request tracking.

[Status Values]
- Handling: Request is currently being processed
- Success: Request completed successfully
- Error: Request failed with an error

parameters.description: Request ID (from X-Request-Id header of a previous Beetle API call)
parameters.name: reqId

delete.description:
Deletes the tracking details of a specific API request from Beetle.

[Note]
- This only removes the request tracking record from Beetle's memory.
- It does NOT affect any data in Tumblebug or cancel any ongoing operations.

parameters.description: Request ID to delete (from X-Request-Id header of a previous Beetle API call)
parameters.name: reqId

get.description:
Retrieves all API requests tracked by Beetle with optional filters.

[Note]
- Request tracking is managed independently by Beetle (not shared with Tumblebug).
- This API only returns requests made to Beetle, not to Tumblebug.

[Status Values]
- Handling: Request is currently being processed
- Success: Request completed successfully
- Error: Request failed with an error

parameters.description: Filter by HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.)
parameters.name: method

parameters.description: Filter by time in minutes from now (to get recent requests)
parameters.name: time

parameters.description: Option to save the results to a file (set 'true' to activate)
parameters.name: savefile

delete.description:
Deletes all API request tracking records from Beetle.

[Note]
- This only clears Beetle's request tracking memory.
- It does NOT affect any data in Tumblebug or cancel any ongoing operations.

post.description:
Generate a comprehensive source infrastructure summary from on-premise data in multiple formats based on 'format' query parameter:

**Response Format by 'format' Parameter:**
- `format=json`: Returns ApiResponse[SourceInfraSummary] with Content-Type: application/json
- `format=md` (default): Returns markdown string with Content-Type: text/markdown; charset=utf-8
- `format=html`: Returns HTML string with Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8

**Note:** API documentation shows JSON schema for reference, but actual default response is markdown format.

**Markdown example**: https://github.com/cloud-barista/cm-beetle/blob/main/cmd/test-cli/testresult/beetle-summary-source.md

**Download Behavior:**
- `download=false` (default): Content displayed inline (viewable in browser/Swagger UI)
- `download=true`: Content downloaded as file (Content-Disposition: attachment)
post.summary: Generate source infrastructure summary

parameters.description: Summary format: md, html, or json
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: Download as file: true for file download, false for inline display (only affects browsers/Swagger UI, not curl)
parameters.name: download

parameters.description: Unique request ID (auto-generated if not provided). Used for tracking request status and correlating logs.
parameters.name: X-Request-Id

200.description: Successfully generated source infrastructure summary (format varies by 'format' parameter)

Content-Disposition.description: inline; filename=\"source-summary.md\" or \"source-summary.html\" (or attachment when download=true)

500.description: Internal server error during summary generation

get.description:
Generate a comprehensive target infrastructure summary in multiple formats based on 'format' query parameter:

**Response Format by 'format' Parameter:**
- `format=md` (default): Returns markdown string with Content-Type: text/markdown; charset=utf-8
- `format=html`: Returns HTML string with Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
- `format=json`: Returns ApiResponse[TargetInfraSummary] with Content-Type: application/json

**Note:** API documentation shows JSON schema for reference, but actual default response is markdown format.

**Markdown example**: https://github.com/cloud-barista/cm-beetle/blob/main/cmd/test-cli/testresult/beetle-summary-target-aws.md

**Download Behavior:**
- `download=false` (default): Content displayed inline (viewable in browser/Swagger UI)
- `download=true`: Content downloaded as file (Content-Disposition: attachment)

get.description: Checks if the request is authenticated and returns the auth type
Returns multiple JSON objects as newline-delimited JSON (JSON Lines format)

Tests distributed tracing by calling Tumblebug's readyz endpoint.

[Note]
- The 'traceparent' header (W3C Trace Context) is propagated to Tumblebug for distributed tracing.
- The 'X-Request-Id' header is propagated for log correlation.
- Use this API to verify that tracing works correctly between Beetle and Tumblebug.

parameters.description: W3C Trace Context (e.g., 00-4bf92f3577b34da6a3ce929d0e0e4736-00f067aa0ba902b7-01). Used for distributed tracing.
parameters.name: traceparent

parameters.description: Unique request ID. Used for tracking request status and correlating logs.
parameters.name: X-Request-Id

commandExecuted.description: CommandExecuted is the actual SSH command executed on the VM (may be adjusted)

commandRequested.description: CommandRequested is the original command as requested by the user

completedTime.description: CompletedTime is when the command execution completed (success or failure)

elapsedTime.description: ElapsedTime is the duration of command execution in milliseconds

errorMessage.description: ErrorMessage contains error details if the execution failed

index.description: Index is sequential identifier for this command execution (1, 2, 3, ...)

resultSummary.description: ResultSummary provides a brief summary of the execution result

startedTime.description: StartedTime is when the command execution started

status.description: Status represents the current status of the command execution

stderr.description: Stderr contains the standard error from command execution (truncated for history)

stdout.description: Stdout contains the standard output from command execution (truncated for history)

xRequestId.description: XRequestId is the request ID from X-Request-ID header when the command was executed

connectionName.description:
if ConnectionName is given, the VM tries to use associtated credential.
if not, it will use predefined ConnectionName in Spec objects

imageId.description: ImageId is field for id of a image in common namespace

label.description: Label is for describing the object by keywords

name.description: SubGroup name, actual VM name will be generated with -N postfix.

specId.description: SpecId is field for id of a spec in common namespace

subGroupSize.description: if subGroupSize is (not empty) && (> 0), subGroup will be generated. VMs will be created accordingly.

zone.description:
Zone is an optional field to specify the availability zone for VM placement.
If specified, subnet will be created in this zone for resources like GPU VMs
that may only be available in specific zones. If empty, auto-selection applies.

cspResourceId.description: CspResourceId is resource identifier managed by CSP (required for option=register)

label.description: Label is for describing the object by keywords

name.description: SubGroup name of VMs. Actual VM name will be generated with -N postfix.

subGroupSize.description: if subGroupSize is (not empty) && (> 0), subGroup will be generated. VMs will be created accordingly.

CIDR.description: CIDR is the allowed IP range (e.g. 0.0.0.0/0, 10.0.0/8)

Direction.description: Direction is the direction of the rule (inbound or outbound)

Ports.description:
Ports is to get multiple ports or port ranges as a string (e.g. "22,900-1000,2000-3000")
This allows flexibility in specifying single ports or ranges in a comma-separated format.
This field is used to handle both single ports and port ranges in a unified way.
It can accept a single port (e.g. "22"), a range (e.g. "900-1000"), or multiple ports/ranges (e.g. "22,900-1000,2000-3000").

Protocol.description: Protocol is the protocol type for the rule (TCP, UDP, ICMP). Don't use ALL here.

commandHistory.description: CommandHistory stores the status and history of remote commands executed on this VM

cspImageId.description: CspImageId is resource identifier managed by CSP

regionList.description: Array field for supporting multiple regions

resourceType.description: ResourceType is the type of the resource

sourceCspImageName.description: SourceCspImageName is the name of the source CSP image from which this image was created

sourceVmUid.description: SourceVmUid is the UID of the source VM from which this image was created

commandExecuted.description: CommandExecuted is the actual SSH command executed on the VM (may be adjusted)

index.description: Index is sequential identifier for this command execution (1, 2, 3, ...)

example: client_ip=$(echo $SSH_CLIENT | awk '{print $1}'); echo SSH client IP is: $client_ip

failedVmCount.description: FailedVmCount is the number of VMs that failed to be created

failureHandlingStrategy.description: FailureHandlingStrategy indicates how failures were handled

successfulVmCount.description: SuccessfulVmCount is the number of VMs that were successfully created

totalVmCount.description: TotalVmCount is the total number of VMs that were supposed to be created

vmCreationErrors.description: VmCreationErrors contains errors from actual VM creation phase

vmObjectCreationErrors.description: VmObjectCreationErrors contains errors from VM object creation phase

installMonAgent.description: InstallMonAgent Option for CB-Dragonfly agent installation ([yes/no] default:no)

label.description: Label is for describing the object by keywords

policyOnPartialFailure.description:
PolicyOnPartialFailure determines how to handle VM creation failures
- "continue": Continue with partial MCI creation (default)
- "rollback": Cleanup entire MCI when any VM fails
- "refine": Mark failed VMs for refinement

postCommand.description: PostCommand is for the command to bootstrap the VMs

systemLabel.description: SystemLabel is for describing the mci in a keyword (any string can be used) for special System purpose

configureCloudAdaptiveNetwork.description: ConfigureCloudAdaptiveNetwork is an option to configure Cloud Adaptive Network (CLADNet) ([yes/no] default:yes)

creationErrors.description: CreationErrors contains information about VM creation failures (if any)

id.description: Id is unique identifier for the object

installMonAgent.description: InstallMonAgent Option for CB-Dragonfly agent installation ([yes/no] default:no)

label.description: Label is for describing the object by keywords

name.description: Name is human-readable string to represent the object

newVmList.description: List of IDs for new VMs. Return IDs if the VMs are newly added. This field should be used for return body only.

postCommand.description: PostCommand is for the command to bootstrap the VMs

postCommandResult.description: PostCommandResult is the result of the command for bootstraping the VMs

resourceType.description: ResourceType is the type of the resource

systemLabel.description: SystemLabel is for describing the mci in a keyword (any string can be used) for special System purpose

systemMessage.description: Latest system message such as error message

uid.description: Uid is universally unique identifier for the object, used for labelSelector

installMonAgent.description: InstallMonAgent Option for CB-Dragonfly agent installation ([yes/no] default:yes)

label.description: Label is for describing the object by keywords

policyOnPartialFailure.description:
PolicyOnPartialFailure determines how to handle VM creation failures
- "continue": Continue with partial MCI creation (default)
- "rollback": Cleanup entire MCI when any VM fails
- "refine": Mark failed VMs for refinement

postCommand.description: PostCommand is for the command to bootstrap the VMs

systemLabel.description: SystemLabel is for describing the mci in a keyword (any string can be used) for special System purpose

cspResourceId.description: CspResourceId is required to register object from CSP (option=register)
cspResourceId.example: required for option=register only. ex: csp-06eb41e14121c550a

cspSpecName.description: CspSpecName is name of the spec given by CSP

id.description: Id is unique identifier for the object

infraType.description: InfraType can be one of vm|k8s|kubernetes|container, etc.

name.description: Name is human-readable string to represent the object

systemLabel.description: SystemLabel is for describing the Resource in a keyword (any string can be used) for special System purpose

uid.description: Uid is universally unique identifier for the object, used for labelSelector

fingerprint.description: Fingerprint is the SHA256 fingerprint of the SSH host key

firstUsedAt.description: FirstUsedAt is the timestamp when the host key was first stored (TOFU moment)

hostKey.description: HostKey is the SSH host public key (base64 encoded)

keyType.description: KeyType is the type of the SSH host key (e.g., ssh-rsa, ssh-ed25519, ecdsa-sha2-nistp256)

cspResourceId.description:
Fields for "Register existing SSH keys" feature
CspResourceId is required to register object from CSP (option=register)

phase.description: Phase indicates when the error occurred

vmName.description: VmName is the name of the VM that failed

commandStatus.description: CommandStatus stores the status and history of remote commands executed on this VM

cspResourceId.description: CspResourceId is resource identifier managed by CSP

cspResourceName.description: CspResourceName is name assigned to the CSP resource. This name is internally used to handle the resource.

id.description: Id is unique identifier for the object

name.description: Name is human-readable string to represent the object

resourceType.description: ResourceType is the type of the resource

sshHostKeyInfo.description: SshHostKeyInfo contains SSH host key information for TOFU (Trust On First Use) verification

subGroupId.description: defined if the VM is in a group

systemMessage.description: Latest system message such as error message

uid.description: Uid is universally unique identifier for the object, used for labelSelector

endTime.description: The time when the request was fully processed.

errorResponse.description: A message describing any error that occurred during request processing.

responseData.description: The data sent back in response to the request.

startTime.description: The time when the request was received by the server.

status.description: The current status of the request (e.g., "Handling", "Error", "Success").

header.description: Key-value pairs of the request headers.

method.description: HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.), indicating the request's action type.

policyOnPartialFailure.description:
PolicyOnPartialFailure determines how to handle VM creation failures
- "continue": Continue with partial MCI creation (default)
- "rollback": Cleanup entire MCI when any VM fails
- "refine": Mark failed VMs for refinement

CIDR.description: CIDR is the allowed IP range (e.g. 0.0.0.0/0, 10.0.0/8)

Direction.description: Direction is the direction of the rule (inbound or outbound)

Port.description: Port is the single port (e.g. "22") or port range (e.g. "1-65535") for the rule

Protocol.description: Protocol is the protocol type for the rule (TCP, UDP, ICMP, ALL)

CIDR.description: CIDR is the allowed IP range (e.g. 0.0.0.0/0, 10.0.0/8)

Direction.description: Direction is the direction of the rule (inbound or outbound)

Ports.description:
Ports is to get multiple ports or port ranges as a string (e.g. "22,900-1000,2000-3000")
This allows flexibility in specifying single ports or ranges in a comma-separated format.
This field is used to handle both single ports and port ranges in a unified way.
It can accept a single port (e.g. "22"), a range (e.g. "900-1000"), or multiple ports/ranges (e.g. "22,900-1000,2000-3000").

Protocol.description: Protocol is the protocol type for the rule (TCP, UDP, ICMP). Don't use ALL here.

commandExecuted.description: CommandExecuted is the actual SSH command executed on the VM (may be adjusted)

index.description: Index is sequential identifier for this command execution (1, 2, 3, ...)

connectionName.description:
if ConnectionName is given, the VM tries to use associtated credential.
if not, it will use predefined ConnectionName in Spec objects

imageId.description: ImageId is field for id of a image in common namespace

label.description: Label is for describing the object by keywords

name.description: K8sCluster name if it is not empty. Optional when used with namePrefix in multi-cluster creation.

nodeGroupName.description: NodeGroup name if it is not empty

specId.description: SpecId is field for id of a spec in common namespace

cores.description: Number of physical cores per CPU

threads.description: Number of logical CPUs (threads) per CPU with hyper-threading enabled

interfaceName.description: Name of the network interface associated with the gateway

machineId.description: Unique identifier for the machine (e.g., UUID)

ipv4CidrBlocks.description: IPv4 address with prefix length (e.g., 192.168.0.21/24), instead of inet addr, Bcast, and Mask

destination.description: Destination network, expressed in CIDR format

gateway.description: Gateway address to which packets are forwarded

interface.description: Network interface associated with the route

linkState.description: Link state of the route (e.g., UP, DOWN)

metric.description: Metric value indicating the priority of the route

protocol.description: Protocol used to set the route (e.g., kernel, static)

scope.description: Scope of the route (e.g., global, link, host)

source.description: Optionally stores the source address (used for policy-based routing)

machineId.description: Unique identifier for the server (e.g., UUID)

commandHistory.description: CommandHistory stores the status and history of remote commands executed on this VM

cspImageId.description: CspImageId is resource identifier managed by CSP

regionList.description: Array field for supporting multiple regions

resourceType.description: ResourceType is the type of the resource

sourceCspImageName.description: SourceCspImageName is the name of the source CSP image from which this image was created

sourceVmUid.description: SourceVmUid is the UID of the source VM from which this image was created

usageCount.description: Number of VMs using this image

cspSpecName.description: CspSpecName is name of the spec given by CSP

id.description: Id is unique identifier for the object

infraType.description: InfraType can be one of vm|k8s|kubernetes|container, etc.

name.description: Name is human-readable string to represent the object

systemLabel.description: SystemLabel is for describing the Resource in a keyword (any string can be used) for special System purpose

uid.description: Uid is universally unique identifier for the object, used for labelSelector

usageCount.description: Number of VMs using this spec

filesystem.description: Access configuration (one of the following based on StorageType)

path.description:
Path to the data
For Filesystem: File path (e.g., "/data", "/home/user/data")
For ObjectStorage: Bucket/Key (e.g., "my-bucket/my-key")

postCmd.description: Command to run after transfer (destination only)

storageType.description:
StorageType: What kind of storage
"filesystem": Local or remote filesystem
"objectstorage": S3-compatible object storage

strategy.description:
Strategy determines how the transfer is orchestrated.
"auto": Automatically select best method.
"direct": Force direct transfer (e.g., SSH agent forwarding).
"relay": Force relay via local machine.

accessType.description:
AccessType: How to access the filesystem
"local": Local filesystem (no network)
"ssh": Remote filesystem via SSH

AccessType: How to access object storage
"minio": Direct S3 SDK access using minio-go
"spider": Via CB-Spider Object Storage API
"tumblebug": Via CB-Tumblebug Object Storage API

minio.description: Provider-specific configurations (one required based on accessType)

privateKey.description:
Authentication (priority: PrivateKey > PrivateKeyPath > Agent > none)
At least one authentication method should be available.

PrivateKey: PEM-encoded private key content (preferred for injected secrets).
In JSON, use single line with \n for newlines:
  "privateKey": "-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\nMIIE...\n-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----"

privateKeyPath.description: Path to private key file (legacy, prefer PrivateKey)

useAgent.description: Use SSH agent for authentication (supports agent forwarding)

BearerAuth.description: Enter your bearer token in the format **Bearer <token>**
BearerAuth.name: Authorization
